main event: An unidentified flying object was sighted over Fairfield, Utah on April 16, 1956, by Captain Thomas P. Petit during an IFR mission.
interesting points: The object appeared to be a bright silver ball or globe, larger than a car, and plummeting at a high rate of speed., The sighting lasted approximately 25 minutes, with the object displaying erratic movements and blinking blue to white light., The object increased in size and changed color as it approached, from bright silver to dull gray., Captain Petit maintained visual contact for most of the sighting until it disappeared into an overcast., The object was initially thought to be a normal aircraft but exhibited rapid acceleration and an unusual flight pattern.
sighted object: a bright silver ball or globe
